abstract_summ: Based on the results of SutteARIMA fitting data, the accuracy of SutteARIMA for the period 11 April 2020 - 17 April 2020 is 0.61% and we forecast 20.000 confirmed cases of Spain by the WHO situation report day 90/91 which is 19 April 2020 / 20 April 2020.In this article, we analyze the growth pattern of Covid-19 pandemic in India from March 4th to May 15th using regression analysis (exponential and polynomial), auto-regressive integrated moving averages (ARIMA) model as well as Exponential Smoothing and Holt-Winters models.The results showed an increasing trend in the actual and forecasted numbers of COVID-19 cases with approximately 1500 cases per day, based on available data as on 04th April 2020.Based on the results of ARIMA and SutteARIMA forecasting methods, we conclude that the SutteARIMA method is most suitable than ARIMA to calculate the daily forecasts of confirmed cases of Covid-19 and IBEX in Spain.In this paper, we have conducted analysis based on data obtained from National Institute of Health (NIH) - Islamabad and produced a forecast of COVID-19 confirmed cases as well as the number of deaths and recoveries in Pakistan using the Auto-Regressive Integrated Moving Average Model (ARIMA).In the present study, public health database from Algeria health ministry has been used to build an ARFIMA model and used to forecast COVID-19 new cases in Algeria until May 11, 2020.Abstract:
title_summ: The date predicted 200.000 cases of Covid-19 in Spain using SutteARIMAModelling of Covid-19 cases in India using Regression and Time Series modelsForecasting the spread of COVID-19 in Nigeria using Box-Jenkins Modeling ProcedureForecasting COVID-19 new cases in Algeria using Autoregressive fractionally integrated moving average Models (ARFIMA)Time series forecasting of COVID-19 confirmed cases with ARIMA model in the South East Asian countries of India and Thailand: a comparative case studySutteARIMA: Short-term forecasting method, a case: Covid-19 and stock market in SpainShort-term forecasting of daily COVID-19 cases in Brazil by using the Holt’s modelStatistical Analysis of Forecasting COVID-19 for Upcoming Month in PakistanARIMA and NAR based Prediction Model for Time Series Analysis of COVID-19 cases in India
title_abstract_phrases: In the present study, public health database from Algeria health ministry has been used to build an ARFIMA model and used to forecast COVID-19 new cases in Algeria until May 11, 2020.Time series forecasting of COVID-19 confirmed cases with ARIMA model in the South East Asian countries of India and Thailand: a comparative case studyAbstract:Based on the results of SutteARIMA fitting data, the accuracy of SutteARIMA for the period 11 April 2020 - 17 April 2020 is 0.61% and we forecast 20.000 confirmed cases of Spain by the WHO situation report day 90/91 which is 19 April 2020 / 20 April 2020.Modelling of Covid-19 cases in India using Regression and Time Series modelsIn this article, we analyze the growth pattern of Covid-19 pandemic in India from March 4th to May 15th using regression analysis (exponential and polynomial), auto-regressive integrated moving averages (ARIMA) model as well as Exponential Smoothing and Holt-Winters models.Statistical Analysis of Forecasting COVID-19 for Upcoming Month in PakistanIn this paper, we have conducted analysis based on data obtained from National Institute of Health (NIH) - Islamabad and produced a forecast of COVID-19 confirmed cases as well as the number of deaths and recoveries in Pakistan using the Auto-Regressive Integrated Moving Average Model (ARIMA).At the end of the analysis, using the SutteARIMA method, we calculate daily forecasts of confirmed cases of Covid-19 in Spain from 10 April 2020 until 12 April 2020 and Spain Stock Market from 14 April until 16 April 2020.Short-term forecasting of daily COVID-19 cases in Brazil by using the Holt’s modelINTRODUCTION: We evaluated the performance of the Holt’s model to forecast the daily COVID-19 reported cases in Brazil and three Brazilian states.The results showed an increasing trend in the actual and forecasted numbers of COVID-19 cases with approximately 1500 cases per day, based on available data as on 04th April 2020.
